text:
375ml bottle via trade with Asheft, thanks Alex, split in two with my uncle.
2008 Harvest.
Couleur amber, caramel, le tout offrant un léger filament huileux sur les rebords du verre.
Arôme est assez classique dans la lignée cidre de glace avec pas mal de belles effluves de pommes et un généreux bouquet caramélisé de pommes pressées.
Palais met en valeur le profil des pommes alernant sur un léger résineux et une douceur de sucre résiduel caramel. Le tout est très frais, parfait en dessert avec un quasi 11% de volume passant sans problème. Petite pointe acerbe parvient tout de meme à percer en fin de bouche offrant ce cacractère de pomme grinçant un peu aux dents. Cidre parfait mettant bien en valeur des variétés canadiennes.

[Bottle shared with GregClow, jercraigs & mabel -- c/o j&m. 2008 vintage] Pours a deep golden-orange with no head. Nice pleasant aroma of sweet apples, caramel and a touch of herbs. Flavour follows (7+) and adds a bit of tartness. Alcohol relatively well hidden. Medium bodied. Quite good and enjoyable.

375ml bottle, 11%. Clear orangey amber colour, no head and aroma of apple concentrate, caramel, butter, apple pie. Taste is sweet and tangy apple, concentrated juice, sugary syrup, caramel, apple pie, with wood, vanilla & oak, and some warming notes. Thick syrupy mouthfeel, full to medium bodied, low carbonation, fairly clean dry lightly tannic finish. Nicely sippable.

375mL bottle, sent from wilco (thanks a lot, Mike), pours a clear golden. Nose is decadent, with notes of treacle toffee, candied apple and high sweetness. Flavour follows accordingly, with treacle toffee and candied apple upfront. Fairly high residual sweetness, but fairly moderate for an ice cider. Complex and decadent. An excellent by-the-books ice cider.

Bottle split at Bespin Base, W2, thanks to his Daniel, 10/06/15.
Clear golden amber with little in the way of head wear.
Nose is sweet, apple pulp, woody, sweet icing sugar, booze fumes, apple pie, caramel.
Taste comprises sweet apple pie, vanilla, caramelised sugar, boozey polka.
Full bodied, oily, sweet close with a boost.
Decent.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at Leightons place. Huge thanks to Daniel for this one. Bright orange, light amber coloured pour, little viscous. Aroma is sweet juicy sweet caramel, apple pie with a little tart apple edge, Flavour is composed of full sticky juicy apple sauce, caramel, caramel, apple pie, little vanilla. A real joy. Palate is full sticky sweet, low carbonation. Tangy finish. Lovely.

Bottle shared at Leightons. This may be the only beverage Ive ever sourced from Amazon.co.uk. 2008 harvest, 11%. Clear orange, still, no head at all. Fucken ice ciders. Aroma is honey, apples, toffee liquer, light plastic in the background. Body is medium, light carbonation, smooth. Taste is sweet honey, apples, big mead vibe, light alcohol, low acidity. Pretty sweet, but totally gets away with it. Very nice.

Bottle shared in London - huge thanks to Daniel. Harvest 2008. Pours totally clear, honey gold, with a few bubbles. Big apple juice aroma, ripe apples, slight peel. Big sweet flavor, lightly oily, lots of ripe apple, Macintosh perhaps, some honey. Medium bodied, softly chewy. Warming finish with gooey, ripe apples, more honey, some caramel. Glorious stuff. Very drinkable.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2015 Bottle big thanks to Daniel. It pours clear oily orange. The nose is soft, juicy, oily, apple pie, sweet apple, pear, light cinnamon and honey. The taste is rich, slick, oily, sweet juicy apple, apple pie, toasty sugars, oily, pear, honey and very light alcohol with a rich, oily finish. Medium-full body and rich, oily mouth-feel. Well rounded and quaffable.

Bottle (375 ml). Harvest 2007. Shared by JM, thanks!

Appearance: Bright dark golden-copper and leaving nice legs on the glass. 

Aroma: Candied apples, brown sugar, mild tartness and light tropical fruits presence.

Taste: Medium to heavy sweetness, but well balanced by a bright acidic presence and moderate tartness. Candied apples, brown sugar, light tropical fruits and light alcohol presence.

Palate: Medium body. Oily / syrupy mouthfeel and quite thick. Acidic finish with a lingering brown sugar sweetness and a mild alcohol warmth. 

Overall: Very good balance between acidity and sweetness. Tasty. Top tier Ice Cider and not to far from La Face Cachée de la Pomme.

Bottle shared. Deep copper pour. Nice rich apple aroma, fleshy apple, light "funk" nice. Taste is sweet, fruity, light cinnamon, tons of apple, rich caramel apple. Palate is silky, nice rich round body. Nice.
Bottle. Pours gold with a thin head. Fruity rich apple, spices, pie, and fresh pressed cider, with light acidity and a rich apple syrupy finish. Delicious.

Clear golden-orange in colour with no head, no lacing. Aroma is of apples, baked apple pie, crust, dough, some alcohol, quite sweet. Flavour is quite sweet, lots of tart apples, a little puckering, more raw apples than baked apples. Sweet warming mouthfeel, medium body, mild carb feeling.
Finishes long, sweet, lots of apples. Its pretty good, tart which is a change for the ice ciders for me.
Opened on September 26, 2010.
Dark apple juice. Caramel apple pie, apple pie, light cinnamon. Medium bodied, mellow sweetness, slight booze. Solid.

Bottle at Pollen Street Social. Pours deep honey like orange, really quite thick and oily. Nose is loaded with sticky apples, sweet vanilla, heavy toffee and distinct honey. Some red berries come through nicely as well. Taste is all about the apple and honey molding together. Thick and decadent stuff. Very rich and full of depth. Great stuff

Bottle from Paul on 01/30/2013 at James apt. Thanks! Glassy, rosy red pour. Viscous mouthfeel as expected; packed with concentrated fruit flavors and a little candy. A much easier drink than the handful of other ice wines/ciders Ive tried.

Bottle courtesy of Paul at the dad palace for the Daduary 2013 tasting. Pours a deep honey orange body with barely any lacing. Aroma is full of rich, sweet apples, spice, juice and honey. Mouthfeel is full and syrupy with notes of rich honey, sweet apples and oak. Another incredible ice cider.

Bottle at James tasting in NYC. Pours amber orange, with light head and lace. Aromas/Flavor of heavy honey, super rich apples, wood and bitter motts apple juice. Carbonation is very soft and the body is ultra thick for a cider. One of the best ciders I have tried.

Bottle 375ml. clear glass. [ Vintage 2006 ]. Clear medium amber orange colour with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy apple, tart apple, light to moderate wood, alcohol, bitter. Flavour is heavy sweet, light to moderate acidic and light light bitter with a long duration, tart, dry, apple, alcohol. Very rich and powerfull - lovely ;O) Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light to moderate alcoholic. [20120324]

Courtesy of MartinT, corked bottle, vintage 2006, 10.5% ABVAmber color. Wonderful aroma, apples, apple skins, apple pie, but with a nice freshness, and citrusy touch. Sweet flavor, with a tartness that reminds apricots, some stewed apples, quite high acidity. Aggressive, yet lovely.Appreciated, probably most for its power than its elegance. Wonderful.

Bottle @ Miss January  / AA Meeting Afterparty Tasting, March 2012. Pours clear copper amber with bubbles on top. Sweet. A bit of honey, red apples, oak and syrup. Sticky and oily. Smooth and really dry. Lovely drink.

A golden lightly rosed coloured ice cider, viscous, with aroma of apple puree and light tropical fruits. In mouth, a nice and smooth sweet apple candy, green apples, and light pineapples. Tasted at Mondial des Cidres de Glaces, Feb. 11 2012.

2006 vintage.
Quite dark, looks like bourbon. Nice tart apple aroma. Light honey, also quite floral. Mouthfeel is a tad thin, and the finish is a little tart and not as sweet as expected.

Sample, Mondial de la bière, savoured on June 9 2011; eye: coppery, clear, no effervescence, no head; nose: lots of candied apples, brown sugar; mouth: lots of candied apples, brown sugar, acidity, finale in candied apples, no carbonation, full body, quite sweet, liqueur-like texture; overall: quite good

FRANÇAIS

Échantillon, Mondial de la bière, savourée le 9 juin 2011; il : cuivrée, limpide, pas deffervescence, pas de mousse; nez : beaucoup de pommes confites, cassonade; bouche : beaucoup de pommes confites, cassonade, acidité, finale en pommes confites, pas de carbonatation, corsé, très sucré, texture liquoreuse; en résumé : bien bon

Pours a dark gold color. Pleasant and appealing aroma of baked apples, vanilla and honey. Very good flavor of baked apples, vanilla and honey, its sweet of course, but the sweetness is well balanced. The body is medium and liquorous. This is a solid ice cider.

Sample at Mondial du Cidre de glace 2011. Labeled as Leduc Cuvée Régulière 2007.
Aroma : Nice exotic fruits with notes of bee wax. Light pinneaple and light overcooked apples.

Taste : Great fruits and bee wax. Some exotic fruits like on the nose. Finish has lots of exotic fruits. 

Overall : This is my kind of cider. Nice exotic fruits. Nice acidity. I really enjoyed the bee wax notes of this one. One of my top ice ciders.

Pouring at Le Mondial des Cidres Glaces.  Pours a tawny golden amber. Warm brandy and apple notes, vanilla and honey.  Big and smooth with some nice sweetness.  Caramel, toast and warmth.  Toffee, caramel, vanilla and toast on the finish.
Pours gold and still.  Smells a little oaky with some sweet apples and some nutty hints.  Tastes sweet with some vanilla, caramel, sweet apples, some light citrus on the finish.

Bottle (@ The Glasshouse, Kew, Greater London) Clear, orangey-golden coloured; solid aromas of sweet apples, almonds, and caramel in the nose; solid sweet flavour, but not sticky at all, full bodied, silky; solid sweet-fruity finish (honey, caramel and so on...) balanced by a fine tarness. Great experience.....
(375ml bottle, 2005 vintage, courtesy of Bman1113vr)  Pours a clear yellow body with nice legs.  Aroma of apple, apricot, wood, and pear.  Flavor of apple, earth, honey, and subtle wood.
bottle thanks to bman1113vr.  gold pour with no head.  nose is vanilla and apples.  not bad on the palate with a very sweet apple flavor that is quite nice.

bottle thanks to bman1113vr.  poured a light gold with some nice legs.  aroma was great with pear, honey, carmelized apple and some alcohol. flavor was sweet, pear, honey.  this had a very nice body as well.  i really enjoyed this one for my 500th rating.  thanks andrew.

2005 Bottle via a trade with the Cheeseman. 10.8% ABV. Pours with awesome legs over a syrupy golden body. Aroma of baked apple, soil, raisins, and a bit of mead like yeast. Taste is apple, slightly musty, sweet with a light wooden note. A bit of tart or citrus on the finish. Syrupy mouthfeel but on the thinner side for an ice cider. No real alcohol present. Glad to have tried this.

2006 version courtesy of the chairman of PUBN (PA Underground Beer Network), which I am the President of.  The pour is deep coppery with very little head.  Nose is amazing...a medley of juicy, resiny Macintosh and Granny Smith apples, honey, earthy notes, and a very Jadwiga-like overall olfactory impression, but with more tart apply goodness.  The flavor is awsome; this one literally melts in your mouth, woth heavy apple tartness coupled with earthy, honey, white grape, and Irish Mist notes.  This one drips with flavor in every mouthful.  My only beef is that the finish gets a tiny bit cloying, but this one is one of my "try before you die" beverages, and Im glad my old haggard heart held up.  Yeah, man!

Thank you CheeseMan! Awesome color is shockingly red-orange, like blood orange meat. Terrific honey-apple aroma is appealing, bursting with winey goodness. Silky mouthfeel. Incredible panoply of apple flavors including the crisp tartness we all love. Excellent flavors and finishes with crisp tartness instead of cloying sweetness. Lovely.

Bright reddish-amber.  One of the most beautiful ice ciders Ive ever had.  Very brown sugar happy.  Gorgeous dessert - fresh, fruity, with lush sugars and some quality acidity to lend balance.  Killer ice cider.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2009 Bouteille millésimé 2006 en version de 375 ml acheté à la SAQ. Dégusté dans un verre de fruli . Apparence vieille or au reflet orangé cuivré avec dépôt liquoreux apparent sur le verre. Arômes de tangerine, zeste dorange et de citron vert. En bouche on retrouve des saveurs de pamplemousse rose confit et de miel avec en final une douce amertume rafraîchissante. Bien sûr il ne faut pas oublier la pomme, elle est présente de façon agréable au nez et libère son côté amère en bouche en libérant sa pelure sur larrière de ma langue et me procurant une légère plénitude. Un produit divin, dune grande finesse... On va se revoir!

Bottle This cider rocks! Clear amber/orange cider with a beefy nose of sweet apples and spice. Full-bodied and velvety. Fresh, sweet apples indulge my palate while light acidity tantalizes and invigorates. Sweet, warm, tangy finish. Thanks to TheCheeseMan for his generosity in sharing yet another world class ice cider from his stash!

Courtesy Cheeseman.  Pours a clear copper color, with a syrupy looking texture.  Smells of fresh apple, sweet citrus zest, and a little earth.  The flavor was lightly tannic, pretty tart, with the fresh apples just booming with flavor on the tongue.  This is a very nicely done ice cider.  Balanced well, alcohol was masked proficiently, and with a great mouthfeel.  This is a well done ice cider.

0.375L bottle, thanks Roei and Natalie, deep orange colour with some yellowy streaks, light syrupy texture when poured. Aroma of baked apples with some slight cinamon notes. 
complex flavour, first sweet and sour apples, then spices - cinamon and nutmeg, and then lemon and sweet grapefruit. Excellent balance between sweetness and acidity makes this cider feels light and not overbearing. Goes well with honey based deserts which highlight the smooth acidity and let it shine without becoming coarse. Excellent way to start the jewish new year.

Bottled. Better than the reserve IMO. Certainly more traditional, but it does the normal ice cider think pretty well. Surprisingly dark ruby pour. Aroma was appley but thin. This shined in the flavor, with a well defined sweet apple and some spice. Not nearly enough body, and not enough kick and general. Mellow. Still a solid effort, despite the somewhat harsh words.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2016 [1483-20080601] Bottle. Freshly chopped dusty apple aroma. Clear, golden orange body with no head. Pressed dusty apples flavour has sugary sweet everything. Medium body. Good.
(Vintage 2004; 5T @ Mondial; Montreal, QC)

[8126B-20160401] 375mL bottle, 2008. Furry toasted apple and spiced fruit aroma. Clear, orange body with no lasting head. Spiced apple tart flavour has a lingering toasted sweet skin aftertaste. Medium-full body has a little boozy feel. Delicious and has a neat tart kick. (8/3/8/4/16) 3.9
(w/ blankboy, GregClow, jercraigs)

UPDATED: APR 20, 2016 2016-04-01. Crisp golden amber body, headless. Aroma of apple skins and baked apples. Sweet apple juice. Flavour is sweet up front, with a light balancing acidity, a bit more notes of apple skins in the finish than I care for. Smooth medium to full bodied palate, not carbonation, syrupy body. Lovely, but not as refined as some. 8/3-4/8/4/16 Bottle courtesy of a friend.
2008-06-01. Rich golden body lightly coats the glass. Sweet aroma, touches of fruity lychee are more like an ice wine than most ciders I have tried, brief alcohol, apple sauce and skins in the back. (7+) Sweet introduction quickly turns tart before a sweet fruity core. More of the lychee like fruit in the finish, lingering in to the aftertaste. Smooth medium bodied palate is nice. (4+) 7/4/8/4/16 2004 Vintage Bottle, Mondial, Montreal, 5T
Échantillon au Salon des Métiers dArts 06. Jaune pale. Arome de pomme faiblement sucré. Assez bon goût de pomme pas trop sucré.

Fairly tart and lightly woody appleskins and pears in the aroma.  Clear deep golden body with nice legs on the glass.  Very well blended and drinkable apples and brown sugar with a leafy note.  Quite sweet.  Rich medium body is gently warming.  Sampled at Mondial 2006.

Bouteille claire de 375 ml achetée directement à la cidrerie lors de la tournée des cidreries organisée par Goldorak. Arôme: Odeur de pommes (Granny Smith). Apparence: La couleur est jaune paille. Saveur: Léger goût damertume de pommes vertes et dalcool. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture huileuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Présence dalcool en arrière goût. (Rating #554)

Light and still golden shade, gentle legs forming on the glass. A more straightforward cider than their Réserve, similarly offering a wide tropical fruit plate of flavours, though not quite with the same concentration and lesser alcohol flavours. Less tart than the Réserve as well, but still considerably so, in a woody fashion that assembles the flavours together. Quite thin though.

A balanced aroma offers green apple skin tartness and comforting sweetness in equal doses...Medium-bodied for the ice cider category, this one also offers lactic pears to diversify its flavor profile...Green apple tartness continues into an easy finish, with a splash of alcohol...Linear from beginning to end, but a fun sipper nonetheless...

Small sample from the bottle (375 ml) at the Mondial de la Bière in Montreal,  2006. Thick legs oil the glass abouve the light sparkly amber body....a supple, inviting aroma of medium-tart apple skins, only light sweetness, and some lovely farmhouse funkiness with a few minutes warmth....very sweet though on the tongue, a touch minerallic, with and underlying sharpness throughout....dries out a bit at the end...very acidic throughout and growing in complexity, quite excellent.

2004 vintageLightly viscous and pleasing apple juice yellow, with a few greenish reflects when exposed to light.
The apples come out fresh and tangy in the nose, but with an interesting herbal, grassy middle with a bit of hay as well.  The finish is a mix of brown sugar sweet and woody, solvent-like higher fusels that Ive seldom detected in an ice cider.
In the lower spectrum in terms of acidity, which is a bit of a shame because it tends to smooth out the booze and cloyness.  Taste was entrancing through, with touches of cinnamon, banana, mangoes and pineapple.  Body was a bit light, and alcohol was apparent in the finish as it heated up my tongue.  Overall not a bad outing for a ciderhouse still in its infancy.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2008 Sampled at Mondial 2006. Poured with a fairly light yellow colored body. The aroma was slightly tart with Granny Smiths and some alcohol that made me think of brandy. Tart apple taste with peel and core playing strong roles. There is also some dry grass in the taste. A little one dimensional and even a thin mouthfeel for an ice cider. However, it is still tasty, not as overpowering as some competitors.
